moves.3. Nf3 Nc6: Now it looks like a four knights game.
moves.4. g3 Bc5 5. Bg2: The Fianchetto of the bishop, foreshadowed by g3.
moves.5... d5 6. exd5 Nxd5 7. O-O O-O: Everyone castles.  White's fortification looks more impressive, but whether that is just a facade remains to be seen.
moves.8. d3: White opens the bishop diagonal.  Black has three pieces deployed and dominates the center, whereas white's fianchettoed bishop is kind of buried.  The f knight lacks range of motion.  The pawn move seems like it could have been delayed--trading knights would prevent white's pawns from being doubled while drawing the black queen into the field early.
moves.8... Nxc3 9. bxc3 Bg4 10. h3 Bh5 11. Qe1: Honestly, I'm unsure of the point of this move.
moves.12... Rb8: Black mimics again.  But for black this move seems to make more sense, getting the rook off the diagonal remotely threatened by white's fianchettoed bishop.
moves.13. Qe2: White immobilizes Nf3.  Honestly, no outlines of any plan seem yet formed.
moves.13... Qd6 14. g4 Bf7 15. c4 Nd4: White eyes b7, unleashing the fianchettoed bishop with a knight exchange.
moves.17. Bxb7 Qd7: Black is going to put a lot of pressure on Bb7.  But white can delay and get the rooks defending each other first.
moves.18. Be3 Bxe3: The bishop trade exposes the undefended a pawns.
moves.21... Rxa2 22. Bxc6 Qc8: Black pins the bishop.  But white sees the bishop is salvageable--the real threat now is on c2.
moves.23. Rfc1 Be8: Now the bishop must be rescued.
moves.24. Bd5+: Black has to interpose the bishop or lose the queen.  Up two all even trades now favor white.
moves.24... Bf7 25. Bxf7+: Again, Rxf7 sacrifices the queen.  The black king exits the castle instead.
moves.25... Kxf7 26. Qd5+: Rb7 is defended by the white queen.  The next moves will be critical.
moves.26... Qe6: Blunder.  The reason is that Rb7 drives off the black queen's defense.
moves.27. Rb7+ Kg6 28. Qxe6 Raa8 29. Qf5+: I was in the hospital these moves, and so programmed this sequence in.  Instead of mentioning that in chat I accidentally wrote it in the notes, where my opponent couldn't see it.  But always always program force mates.  That should simply go without saying.
